items.title: Iran fires missiles at Israel and Gulf states after U.S.-Israeli strike kills Khamenei
items.standfirst: Iran fired missiles at targets in Israel and Gulf Arab states Sunday after vowing massive retaliation for the killing of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei by the United States and Israel.
items.content: Iran fired missiles at targets in Israel and Gulf Arab states Sunday after vowing massive retaliation for the killing of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei by the United States and Israel.(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)

items.title: War with Iran | CBS News Special
items.standfirst: Tony Dokoupil anchors special coverage of the large-scale military operation launched by the U.S. and Israel on Iran, killing Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who ruled for nearly 40 years. President Trump said the U.S. would continue "heavy and pinpoint bombing" throughout the week or "as long as necessary."

items.title: Iran supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei dies, killed in joint US‚ÄìIsraeli attack
items.standfirst: Iran‚Äôs supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei died at the age of 86 in a major attack on Iran launched by Israel and the United States, state media confirmed. As the head of the Islamic Republic of Iran since 1989, Khamenei was at the heart of the regime‚Äôs hardline positions on an Islamic society which persisted despite domestic discontent and protests. His foreign policy decisions made him a key player in the tumultuous politics of the Middle East, earning him some allies and many powerful foes.
items.content: Iran‚Äôs supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei died at the age of 86 in a major attack on Iran launched by Israel and the United States, state media confirmed. As the head of the Islamic Republic of Iran since 1989, Khamenei was at the heart of the regime‚Äôs hardline positions on an Islamic society which persisted despite domestic discontent and protests. His foreign policy decisions made him a key player in the tumultuous politics of the Middle East, earning him some allies and many powerful foes.

items.title: Major US-Israeli attacks on Iran: How did we get here ?
items.standfirst: The U.S. and Israel attacked Iran on Saturday in what President Donald Trump said was a massive operation to destroy the country‚Äôs military capabilities and eliminate the threat of it creating a nuclear weapon. Iran‚Äôs Foreign Ministry said it would defend its homeland and its Revolutionary Guard said it launched counterattacks, firing drones and missiles at Israel and strikes aimed at U.S. military installations in Bahrain, Kuwait and Qatar.
items.content: The U.S. and Israel attacked Iran on Saturday in what President Donald Trump said was a massive operation to destroy the country‚Äôs military capabilities and eliminate the threat of it creating a nuclear weapon. Iran‚Äôs Foreign Ministry said it would defend its homeland and its Revolutionary Guard said it launched counterattacks, firing drones and missiles at Israel and strikes aimed at U.S. military installations in Bahrain, Kuwait and Qatar.

items.title: Global News Podcast: US and Israel carry out joint attacks on Iran
items.standfirst: President Trump confirms a 'major operation' underway as Tehran targets US military bases
items.content: President Trump confirms a 'major operation' underway as Tehran targets US military bases

items.title: US and Israel attack Iran as Trump says US begins 'major combat operations'
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday that Washington had begun "major combat operations" in Iran after Israel and the United States launched a joint attack on the Islamic Republic Saturday. In retaliation, Iran attacked Israel as well as several US military bases across the region, notably in Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday that Washington had begun "major combat operations" in Iran after Israel and the United States launched a joint attack on the Islamic Republic Saturday. In retaliation, Iran attacked Israel as well as several US military bases across the region, notably in Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates.

items.title: What to know about the U.S. and Israeli attacks on Iran
items.standfirst: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in Israeli airstrikes with U.S. support on Saturday. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said.
items.content: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in Israeli airstrikes with U.S. support on Saturday. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Where has been hit? Iran retaliates across Middle East after US-Israel strikes
items.standfirst: Multiple locations in Iran have been targeted by joint US-Israel strikes, and Tehran has launched retaliatory missiles across the region.
items.content: Multiple locations in Iran have been targeted by joint US-Israel strikes, and Tehran has launched retaliatory missiles across the region.

items.title: Photos: Israelis seek shelter as Iran launches retaliatory strikes
items.standfirst: Sirens rang out across major cities across Israel after the strikes on Iran and civilians were pictured seeking shelter wherever they could find it.
items.content: Sirens rang out across major cities across Israel after the strikes on Iran and civilians were pictured seeking shelter wherever they could find it.

items.title: Watch: Trump announces 'major combat operations' in Iran
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump accuses the Iranian regime of waging an "unending campaign of bloodshed and mass murder targeting the United States".
items.content: US President Donald Trump accuses the Iranian regime of waging an "unending campaign of bloodshed and mass murder targeting the United States".

items.title: Trump announces beginning of 'major combat operations in Iran'
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump confirmed the strikes on Iran in a video message shared on Truth Social, reiterating that "they can never have a nuclear weapon."
items.content: President Donald Trump confirmed the strikes on Iran in a video message shared on Truth Social, reiterating that "they can never have a nuclear weapon."

items.title: Explosions heard in Kabul as Afghan forces open fire at Pakistani aircraft
items.standfirst: An explosion and bursts of gunfire were heard in central Kabul on Sunday as the Taliban government said Afghan forces were responding to a new incursion by Pakistani aircraft. The unrest follows months of cross-border clashes that intensified on Thursday after Afghanistan launched a frontier offensive, prompting Pakistani retaliatory strikes.
items.content: An explosion and bursts of gunfire were heard in central Kabul on Sunday as the Taliban government said Afghan forces were responding to a new incursion by Pakistani aircraft. The unrest follows months of cross-border clashes that intensified on Thursday after Afghanistan launched a frontier offensive, prompting Pakistani retaliatory strikes.

items.title: At least 20 killed as cash-laden military cargo plane crashes in Bolivia
items.standfirst: Riot police use teargas to disperse people gathering around wreckage of plane loaded with money from central bankAt least 20 people have died and dozens have been injured after a military cargo plane carrying banknotes crashed while landing near Bolivia‚Äôs capital on Friday, damaging about a dozen vehicles on a highway and scattering bills on the ground, an official has said.Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas. Authorities were later seen setting the money alight in a bonfire at the scene of the crash. Continue reading...
